items.label: rem-extinction-inevitable
items.title: Why Extinction is Inevitable (Eventually)
items.content:
596: :label: rem-extinction-inevitable
597: 
598: The use of **unbounded Gaussian noise** means:
599: 
600: $$P(\text{all } N \text{ walkers cross boundary in one step} \mid S) > 0$$
601: 
602: for ANY state $S$, no matter how safe. This is because Gaussian tails extend to infinity, so there's always a positive (though perhaps tiny) probability of a coherent, large-deviation event.
603: 
604: Therefore:
605: - **Absorption is certain:** $P(\text{reach } \dagger \text{ eventually}) = 1$
606: - **No true stationary distribution** on $\Sigma_N$
